Core APIïƒ

This section documents the core DDF classes and functions.

DDF Classïƒ

The main class providing Docker Compose file operations.

class ddf.DDF[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

__init__()ïƒ

Service Operationsïƒ

classmethod find_service(content, service)[source]

Find a service in the YAML content. Supports pattern matching and substring search.

classmethod list_service_names(content, filter=[])[source]

filter support regex, wildchar, or substring matching.

classmethod get_list_service_names(cls, content, filter=[])[source]
classmethod show_service_detail(content, service, line_numbers=True)[source]

Show the full configuration for a given service.

Port Managementïƒ

classmethod find_duplicate_port(content, target_service=None)[source]
classmethod find_port(content, port, compact=True)[source]
classmethod check_duplicate_port(content, port)[source]

Check whether a particular port is duplicate among all services.

classmethod list_service_ports(content, service)[source]

List all ports for a given service.

Volume Managementïƒ

classmethod list_service_volumes(content, service=None)[source]

List all volumes for a given service.

classmethod list_volumes(content, service=None)[source]

Device Managementïƒ

classmethod list_service_devices(content, service=None)[source]

Hostname Managementïƒ

classmethod list_hostnames(content, service=None)[source]

List the hostname(s) for a given service, or all hostnames if no service is specified.

File Operationsïƒ

classmethod open_file(file_path)[source]
classmethod get_content(compose_file)[source]

Dockerfile Operationsïƒ

classmethod get_dockerfile(service_name, show_all=False)[source]

Get the Dockerfile path for a given service name.

classmethod read_dockerfile(path=None, service_name=None, line_numbers=True)[source]

Read the Dockerfile content from the given path with color syntax by rich.Syntax.

classmethod edit_dockerfile(path=None, service_name=None)[source]

Edit the Dockerfile using nvim, nano, or vim. Uses subprocess.run() and checks if the editor is installed. If the Dockerfile does not exist, create a new one in the build context directory. Handles absolute and relative dockerfile paths correctly, and always uses the build context if specified.

classmethod copy_dockerfile(service_name)[source]

Copy the Dockerfile content to the clipboard for a given service. If the Dockerfile does not exist, it will not copy anything.

classmethod set_dockerfile(service_name, dockerfile_path)[source]

Set the Dockerfile path for a given service in the docker-compose.yml. If the service does not exist, it will be created.

Entrypoint Operationsïƒ

classmethod read_entrypoint(service_name, read=True, line_numbers=True)[source]

Read the entrypoint script for a given service. Supports partial name matching (e.g., â€˜authâ€™ matches â€˜auth-serverâ€™).

classmethod edit_entrypoint(service_name)[source]

Edit the entrypoint script for a given service using nvim, nano, or vim.

Service Editingïƒ

classmethod edit_service(file_path=None, service_name=None)[source]

Edit a service section in the YAML file using nvim, nano, or vim. Only the selected service section will be edited and replaced back.

classmethod edit_file(filename, service_name)[source]

Edit a spesific file by line containt â€˜COPYâ€™ in the Dockerfile. check relative path before if is file or not then edit if not or any not then show warning if success after edit then show info too but, if edit and not changed then show info too

classmethod read_file(filename, service_name, line_numbers=True)[source]

Read and display a specific file referenced in a COPY line in the Dockerfile for a service. Shows syntax highlighting if possible.

Service Managementïƒ

classmethod new_service(service_name, service_config=None)[source]

Create a new service section in the YAML file. If service exists, it will not be overwritten. If service_config is provided, it will be used as the initial configuration. After creation, open the new service in the editor for user to fill in.

classmethod copy_service(service_name)[source]

Copy a service section to the clipboard. The service section will be formatted as YAML and copied.

classmethod rename_service(old_service_name, new_service_name)[source]

Rename a service section in the YAML file. If the new service name already exists, it will not overwrite it.

classmethod duplicate_server(service_name, new_service_name)[source]

Duplicate a service section in the YAML file. The new service will have the same configuration as the original service.

classmethod remove_service(service_name)[source]

Remove a service section from the YAML file.

classmethod copy_dockerfile_config(from_svc_name, to_svc_name)[source]

Copy Dockerfile from from_svc_name into the build context of to_svc_name and update docker-compose file for to_svc_name to point to the copied Dockerfile.

Behavior:

  • If target build context directory doesnâ€™t exist it will be created.

  • If a Dockerfile already exists at target, a unique name will be chosen: Dockerfile, Dockerfile-<svc>, Dockerfile-<svc>-1, â€¦

  • After successful copy, docker-compose.yml will be updated: services[to_svc_name].build.dockerfile = <relative-or-basename>

Returns:

Path to created file on success, None on failure.

Return type:

str or None

THEME = 'fruity'ïƒ

Read the Dockerfile content from the given path with color syntax by rich.Syntax.

classmethod read_entrypoint1(service_name, read=True, line_numbers=True)[source]ïƒ

Read the entrypoint script for a given service. Tries to resolve the entrypoint path by analyzing COPY instructions in the Dockerfile.

classmethod read_entrypoint2(service_name, read=True, line_numbers=True)[source]ïƒ

Read the entrypoint script for a given service.

Resolves the entrypoint path by:

  1. Parsing the Dockerfile for ENTRYPOINT

  2. Finding the corresponding COPY instruction

  3. Resolving the source path relative to the docker-compose build context

classmethod read_entrypoint(service_name, read=True, line_numbers=True)[source]ïƒ

Read the entrypoint script for a given service. Supports partial name matching (e.g., â€˜authâ€™ matches â€˜auth-serverâ€™).

classmethod edit_entrypoint(service_name)[source]ïƒ

Edit the entrypoint script for a given service using nvim, nano, or vim.

classmethod edit_dockerfile(path=None, service_name=None)[source]ïƒ

Edit the Dockerfile using nvim, nano, or vim. Uses subprocess.run() and checks if the editor is installed. If the Dockerfile does not exist, create a new one in the build context directory. Handles absolute and relative dockerfile paths correctly, and always uses the build context if specified.

classmethod edit_service(file_path=None, service_name=None)[source]ïƒ

Edit a service section in the YAML file using nvim, nano, or vim. Only the selected service section will be edited and replaced back.

Create a new service section in the YAML file. If service exists, it will not be overwritten. If service_config is provided, it will be used as the initial configuration. After creation, open the new service in the editor for user to fill in.

classmethod copy_dockerfile_config(from_svc_name, to_svc_name)[source]ïƒ

Copy Dockerfile from from_svc_name into the build context of to_svc_name and update docker-compose file for to_svc_name to point to the copied Dockerfile.

Behavior:

  • If target build context directory doesnâ€™t exist it will be created.

  • If a Dockerfile already exists at target, a unique name will be chosen: Dockerfile, Dockerfile-<svc>, Dockerfile-<svc>-1, â€¦

  • After successful copy, docker-compose.yml will be updated: services[to_svc_name].build.dockerfile = <relative-or-basename>

Returns:

Path to created file on success, None on failure.

Return type:

str or None

Decoratorsïƒ

ddf.cache_with_invalidation(ttl=None, key_prefix='', invalidate_on=None, validation=None)[source]ïƒ

Decorator for caching with smart invalidation.

Parameters:

  • ttl (Optional[int]) â€“ Time to live in seconds

  • key_prefix (str) â€“ Prefix for cache key

  • invalidate_on (Optional[list]) â€“ List of patterns to invalidate

  • validation (Optional[Callable]) â€“ Function to check if backend changed (returns hash/version)

Decorator for caching with smart invalidation.

Parameters:

  • ttl (int | None) â€“ Time to live in seconds

  • key_prefix (str) â€“ Prefix for cache key

  • invalidate_on (list | None) â€“ List of patterns to invalidate

  • validation (Callable | None) â€“ Function to check if backend changed

Returns:

Decorated function
